title: CVPR_2009_10_abs

sentences.text: We propose a novel probabilistic framework for learning visual models of 3D object categories by combining appearance information and geometric constraints .
Objects are represented as a coherent ensemble of parts that are consistent under 3D viewpoint transformations .
Each part is a collection of salient image features .
A generative framework is used for learning a model that captures the relative position of parts within each of the discretized viewpoints .
Contrary to most of the existing mixture of viewpoints models , our model establishes explicit correspondences of parts across different viewpoints of the object class .
Given a new image , detection and classification are achieved by determining the position and viewpoint of the model that maximize recognition scores of the candidate objects .
Our approach is among the first to propose a generative proba-bilistic framework for 3D object categorization .
We test our algorithm on the detection task and the viewpoint classification task by using '' car '' category from both the Savarese et al. 2007 and PASCAL VOC 2006 datasets .
We show promising results in both the detection and viewpoint classification tasks on these two challenging datasets .

summary: We propose a novel probabilistic framework for learning visual models of 3D object categories by combining appearance information and geometric constraints . Objects are represented as a coherent ensemble of parts that are consistent under 3D viewpoint transformations . Each part is a collection of salient image features . A generative framework is used for learning a model that captures the relative position of parts within each of the discretized viewpoints . Contrary to most of the existing mixture of viewpoints models , our model establishes explicit correspondences of parts across different viewpoints of the object class . Given a new image , detection and classification are achieved by determining the position and viewpoint of the model that maximize recognition scores of the candidate objects . Our approach is among the first to propose a generative proba-bilistic framework for 3D object categorization . We test our algorithm on the detection task and the viewpoint classification task by using '' car '' category from both the Savarese et al. 2007 and PASCAL VOC 2006 datasets . We show promising results in both the detection and viewpoint classification tasks on these two challenging datasets .

Predicate-by_combining.label: by combining
Predicate-by_combining.description: The predicate 'by combining' indicates a process of integrating or merging two or more entities (represented by the subject and object) to form a new whole, where the resulting entity possesses characteristics from each contributing part.

Predicate-are_represented_as.label: are represented as
Predicate-are_represented_as.description: The predicate 'are represented as' indicates that the subject (in this case, Objects) can be understood or described through the object (a coherent ensemble of parts), suggesting a conceptual equivalence between them. This connection implies that the properties and characteristics of the subject are reflected in the description provided by the object.

Predicate-are_consistent_under.label: are consistent under
Predicate-are_consistent_under.description: The predicate 'are consistent under' indicates that a relationship exists between the subject and object such that the properties or characteristics of the subject remain unchanged, stable, or coherent when viewed from the perspective or transformed by the object. In other words, it suggests that the subject's inherent nature is preserved despite any transformations, modifications, or changes imposed by the object.

Predicate-is_a_collection_of.label: is a collection of
Predicate-is_a_collection_of.description: The predicate 'is a collection of' indicates that the subject represents a grouping or aggregation of entities described by the object. It implies a relationship where the subject is composed of, comprised of, or characterized by the features, properties, or elements specified by the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' establishes a relationship of equivalence or identity between the subject and object. It indicates that the subject has the same characteristics, properties, or essence as the object.

Predicate-is_used_for.label: is used for
Predicate-is_used_for.description: The predicate 'is used for' indicates a functional relationship between its subject and object. It suggests that the subject is employed or applied to achieve a specific purpose, goal, or outcome described by the object.

Predicate-contrasts_with.label: contrasts with
Predicate-contrasts_with.description: The predicate 'contrasts with' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) has distinct characteristics or features that differ significantly from those of another entity (the object). This contrast can be based on various aspects such as perspective, approach, methodology, outcome, or other relevant criteria. The connection between the subject and object is characterized by an inherent opposition, distinction, or disparity.

Predicate-is_among_the_first_to_propose.label: is among the first to propose
Predicate-is_among_the_first_to_propose.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a pioneering role in proposing something related to the object. It suggests that the subject's proposal was one of the earliest or most influential among others, and implies a level of innovation, originality, or groundbreaking nature.

Predicate-test.label: test
Predicate-test.description: To test means to evaluate or examine something (typically an idea, concept, method, or system) in order to determine its validity, accuracy, effectiveness, or quality. The predicate 'test' connects the subject and object by indicating that the subject is performing some kind of evaluation on the object.

Predicate-show.label: show
Predicate-show.description: To indicate or demonstrate the existence of something, often in a way that reveals its nature, quality, or significance. The predicate 'show' connects the subject to an object by highlighting or revealing aspects about it.

Predicate-are_used_for.label: are used for
Predicate-are_used_for.description: The predicate 'are used for' indicates a purpose or function that something (the subject) serves. It connects the subject to an activity, process, or goal (the object), implying that the subject has a specific role or application in achieving or accomplishing the stated objective.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: The predicate 'proposes' indicates the act of suggesting or putting forward an idea, plan, or solution. It implies a deliberate and intentional action by the subject to present something as a viable option for consideration.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject employs or relies on the object to achieve a specific purpose, goal, or function. It suggests a relationship of dependence or utilization between the two entities.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To suggest or put forward an idea, plan, or proposal as a potential solution or approach.

Predicate-is_used.label: is used
Predicate-is_used.description: The predicate 'is used' indicates a relationship where the subject (a person, entity, or thing) employs, utilizes, or makes use of something else (the object), often for a specific purpose or function.

Predicate-is_used_to_propose.label: is used to propose
Predicate-is_used_to_propose.description: The predicate 'is used to propose' indicates how something (the object) serves as a means or tool for proposing, suggesting that it provides a framework, method, or approach for making proposals. In this sense, the subject and object are connected by their shared purpose of proposal-making.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (a concept or entity) encompasses or subsumes the object (also a concept or entity), suggesting a hierarchical relationship between them. In this sense, the subject provides a more specific context for understanding the object.
